intro: Allium sphaerocephalon var. pygmaeum, commonly known as the dwarf globeflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It features a rosette of narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, pale purple to white flowers arranged in a spherical cluster. The plant typically grows to a height of only a few inches, making it a compact and ornamental addition to gardens. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, often found in alpine or rocky habitats. Its botanical structure is adapted to withstand cold climates and arid conditions.
